isis.stitle: FRONT DRIVE AXLE WHEEL ENDS: FABCO SDA-12 - REASSEMBLY - SUSPENSION YOKE ASSEMBLY

step1.para: If any or all of the suspension yoke studs were removed, new studs are to be pressed into housing assembly.

Apply Loctite Sleeve N'Bearing Mount #609 (green) to the outer edge of the inner drive yoke seal assembly ( Figure 30). Use a seal installer tool to press the seal into the suspension yoke as shown in Figures 31 and Figure 32.

figure.caption: Figure 31. Applying Sealant to Inner Drive Yoke Seal
Figure 32. Seal Positioned In Suspension Yoke Housing

step1.para: Insert the lower kingpin disc with the large end of the lube fitting tapered hole toward the top of the suspension yoke. Press the lower kingpin bearing into place in an arbor press or use a push plate and a C-clamp. Do not use the kingpin ball stud to press in the bearing. Lightly lubricate the bearing and install the O-ring.

Apply a bead of liquid sealant to the axle housing flange as shown in Figure 43. Refer to GENERAL PRECAUTIONS Item #1. Install the suspension yoke with hardened washers and locknuts. Tighten to 250 ft-lbs. (340 N·m).

Install a new O-ring and a new upper kingpin bearing into the upper kingpin bracket. Apply a light coat of lubricant to the inside of the socket and to the ball section of the upper kingpin ball stud. Insert the ball stud through the bearing and bracket and into the tapered hole in the suspension yoke. Install the plain washer and the locknut. (See Figure 33). Tighten to 250 ft-lbs. (340 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 34. Tightening Suspension Yoke Mounting Nuts

step1.para: Assemble the inner axle yoke spacer ring on the inner axle shaft against the shoulder behind the spline. Install the inner drive yoke (without the pressed-on bearing race) onto the spline as shown in Figure 34.

figure.caption: Figure 35. Installing Inner Axle Yoke on Axle Shaft

step1.para: Install the short (1-3/4 inch) bolt into a new sealing washer (small diameter), through the retaining washer (large diameter), and into the shaft end ( Figure 35). Tighten to 125 ft-lbs. (170 N·m) as shown in Figure 36.

figure.caption: Figure 36. Assemble Inner Drive Yoke Bolt
Figure 37. Tightening Inner Drive Yoke Bolt to Specification

step1.para: Apply lubricant to the inner drive yoke hub area. Insert the proper inner drive yoke shaft assembly through the suspension yoke (refer to Figure 26). Caution must be taken to avoid damaging the inner drive yoke seal assembly. Rotate the inner drive yoke shaft assembly until it engages the side gears on the differential assembly. Continue to slide the shaft inward until it engages the seal assembly. Care should be exercised to prevent damage to the primary seal lip and to insure the drive yoke hub is seated in the bronze bearing portion of the seal without distorting the large rubber diaphragm section of the floating seal.
